message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about a novel architecture for neural machine translation (NMT), which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the computer science category of "Computation and Language" (cs.CL). The paper proposes a memory-augmented NMT (M-NMT) architecture, which involves storing knowledge in a memory and utilizing it to assist the neural model. This approach involves using techniques from artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML), which are also relevant subfields of computer science. The paper also evaluates the proposed architecture using metrics such as BLEU score, which are commonly used in machine learning and optimization (cs.LG) research. Additionally, the paper involves processing and analyzing language data, which can be considered a form of computer vision (cs.CV) for text. Finally, the paper proposes a solution for out-of-vocabulary (OOV) words, which is a common problem in NLP and can be addressed using techniques from neural networks (cs.NE).
